Sure, I could bore you with delusions of how wonderful I am, but let's face it, I'm sure you've already read this about two hundred times before... I believe that actions speak louder than words, so why bother? I usually have a smile. A lot of people have told me that I'm "special" or "gifted". I think they're jealous that I can count to 10, or 20 with my shoes off, and even to 22 in the shower. (don't ask)
MY LIFE: Anywhoo... I surround myself with optimistic people who are going somewhere in life, and no, I don't mean KFC. I'm very open-minded, a risk- taker who is always up for a new adventure. I love dogs, beaches, meaningful conversations, and self-improvement (who doesn't). I keep very busy and love my life. I don't have the time or inclination to hang-out with everyone under the sun anymore, and I have no problem meeting people. I'm extremely selective, and am just fine if I don't meet anyone on here... BUT, if you're someone really really really special, I'd love to have you along for the ride and make our already great lives that much better.
YOU: There's something very special about you. You are curious about the world around you. You can take a joke and are not easily offended. You believe that sarcasm is a spice of life. You can spell (without using spell check), and are generally happy. You are active, (curvy in the right places is a plus), your eyes are bright and convey the depth of your spirit. You are beautiful inside and out, and you think you can actually keep up with me.

This is a story. Real names have been changed to protect the innocent.... :)

 It happened. I met this wonderful lady with which to share some intimate moments. Let's call her Misty. Now Misty is exciting..... She's attractive, she's energetic, she's understanding of my situation, and she's not selfish. For 2 months we were having a really good time whenever we were together. Weekdays worked for us both. The drive was a little long (She's in Shreveport), but oooohhhhh so worth it. She's a little self-conscious about her extra 20 lbs, but soon got over that when she realized that I truly didn't care. I'm certainly not the picture of perfection myself.
One day, as we lay resting from our workout, she dropped the bombshell. "You should know that I'm Bi" she tells me. I took a moment to let that settle in and responded..... "You should know that I'm not". She laughed and said, " That's good, but does it bother you that I am?". I said "Of course not, but why are you telling me now?"
She proceeds to tell me about her friend Jan, with whom she has shared our sensual experiences. (Now we had an agreement of complete discretion, but I decided to let her slide on this one). Jan had told Misty that she would like to meet me, and "share" me if the attraction was mutual. My heart started to race. I paused. My mind started to flash on every man's dream..... Enjoying sex with 2 women at once!!! I tried to keep my excitement under control as I told her that sounded ok to me. (hehehe)
So for a week I fantasized. 2 women. All the positions.... All the pleasures. I had my plan of attack ready.
She had shown me a face pic of Jan. She had hispanic features and looked very pretty. She was in her early 30's, which was a bit young, but Misty assured me that she was very mature and discreet. It was a Tuesday. We were meeting at Chili's for an early lunch so Jan and I could meet. For this day, Misty suggested that we get a room so I had already taken care of that little detail. There is no ladder precisely because of MW increases. Every time the MW is forced upwards, the bottom rungs of the ladder get knocked out - the exact rungs needed by these low-value workers, in order to build experience and work ethic.
Paying a worker whose lack of education and experience produces $7/hr in value a wage of $15/hr, means that an employer would have to hire two people in order to make the money to pay one person's wages - hardly a method for expanding a "ridiculous" profit margin. Actually, that "produces" a negative margin. . . do the math.
I improved my skills through on-the-job training - didn't spend a dime on college. . . didn't earn much more than a dime while I was training, granted - barely enough to feed myself if I was frugal - but the end result was worth it. I get all the work I want (sometimes more than I want), and earn more than MW. 
It is an entitlement when one expects their pay to be significantly more than their marginal value as a worker. . . Econ 101.

post_title: Re RE re rE er Min.Wage & Fast Food
post_text:
Get a job!  Improve work skills!  Let's get off our lazy teenage asses and work!  "Yes, we can!"
I don't know who is who with this back-and-forth on minimum wage/fast food, but I'll have to butt in and say that the fast food industry is one that supports the wealth of it's elite rulers and not an industry that supports the work force.  These bosses make all of this money and their employees make almost dirt.  What the fuck?  I thought in following rules, manners, and wearing the tacky uniforms employees are part of the team.  Why not share this wealth?
But, who cares, right?  Who needs human employees when this is an industry where, very easily, these minimum wage jobs can be taken on by robotics and machines?  That's what all these tycoons care about -- their own money and not giving a fuck about anyone else.  (Check out Alternative News Links, Etc. (9.9.2014) for some vids on robotic work force.)
To put another example out there: Merced used to have Blockbuster Video, and now we don't, but Redbox can be found at numerous locations.  Did Redbox not help in the elimination of a place in which human employees worked?  Once Redbox became known it was only a matter of time before those people-who-got-off-their-asses-and-worked lost their jobs.
Yes, we can improve our backgrounds and jobs skills, and find something elsewhere.  But, let us not deny threats to the work force by the rise of the machines.

Here are just a few pics to see the amatuer workmanship. Pics are worth a thousand words! Included are shots of car rear not being supported and when new quarters were put on it was a domino affect down the rest of the car trying to get the line gap correct, pinch line on side was off 1/4 inch each side, new fenders were buckled due to using a come along to pull front end together, hood had 1/16" by windshield and 1/4" in front, grinding marks left in new painted sheetmetal, car not supported with rockers off which led to big door line gaps at the bottom of doors due to sagging with no support, windsheild wiper valance would not fit between fenders due to come along smashing them into valance, original trunk lid sat 1/4" higher than quarters and was cut and grinded on due to amatuer workmanship......all of these issues have been resolved by another more competant body shop for a fraction of the price paid to Lee Nelson!! 
This what my painter had to say: Well Long story but i subed out my sheet metal work to Lee's Nelson Custom body shop here in Marshall MI. I had another car going and wanted to get both done in a timely manner...well this did not turn out as i had planned. Lee recommened D&R for the sheet metal and said it was the best fit, so i ordered everything from them for him to install, over $3k in new sheet metal. After Lee's shop cut the car all apart without any support what so ever the car sagged in the back..yes even the rockers were removed during this time. Even though I've seen this done before the problem was he never fit any of the panels before installing the rear full quarters and welding them on before fitting anything. This is where the problems started. By the time he made it to the front he was so far off on fittment that he said it was as good as it would be without me paying him more money for it to be correct. This is where i had the real problem...Long story but we went to court and under the law If you do NOT have a contract saying that the body lines will be correct that a shop can give you back your car wheather it's correct or not. He claimed it was as good as he could do. I had tons of pictures showing before and after shot of how the same sheet metal was corrected and everything fit a ton better, but under the law it don't mean a hill of beans. So even if he were to paint a car for you close to the color you were asking and it didn't match other panels on your car...by law it would be ok as long as he said it was as good as he could do unless you wanted to pay more money for it to be correct if you don't have it all written out to the T in a contract. We lost in court because of this...it sucks so i just wanted everyone to know...make sure you get your estimates written so your covered in as much detail as possible or you too could end up with workmanship like i did. I have attached pictures of Lee's Customs quality workmanship for everyone to see. Lesson learned.

News Headline:
Ouch, the Bill for ObamaCare Coming Due
The bill is coming due for ObamaCare, and it's a whopper. 
According to Medicare's actuaries, U.S. health care spending is about to skyrocket. 
ObamaCare continues federal meddling in what was once the finest and cost-effective health care system on the planet is nothing new. 
Back in the 1960s, many Americans paid for doctor and hospital services out of pocket or through modestly priced private insurance.
Health care spending was about 6% of the country's gross domestic product. 
Enter President Lyndon B. Johnson and Medicare. He bought millions of votes by giving seniors free health care that they never paid for through payroll taxes during their working years. He also helped lay the foundations for the entitlement state with Medicaid. 
Medicaid, which was conceived to help poor children, has been gradually expanded to include many working families. ( all government programs are ever-expanding; they never get smaller)
Today health care spending is more than 17% of GDP,  almost 3 times more expensive than it used to be.
Germany and Holland spend about 12% and have about the same coverage that we do.
The extra costs in the U.S. are federally mandated giveaways, inefficiencies and abuse -- about $850 billion
NOTE: The  $850 Billion  that our federal government WASTES in Medicare/Medicaid, is  more than we spend on our entire military.
Think about that.
Federal programs set reimbursements for providers and limit use of many drugs and procedures. Those rules are intended to mirror market prices and informed private decisions but often do not. 
No bureaucratic rule or computer program can even capture all the judgments we put into purchasing decisions to maximize what we squeeze from our incomes to meet our family's needs.
Those decisions build up to become what economists call the invisible hand of the marketplace that guides businesses to make what we need. 
Just as Soviet central planning failed to put enough TVs and beef on store shelves, federally managed health care creates long waits to see doctors and lots of opportunities for 'soft' fraud -- activities by health care providers that game federal rules -- and outright stealing. 
Once again:  the  'gaming of the rules' the  'soft fraud'  and the 'outright  stealing' that are going on within our Federal Government  in the  Medicare and Medicaid programs  adds up to MORE  than the cost of our entire  military.
WTF ??

post_title: More lies from the IRS,  still busy
post_text:
Look at that face.  That snobbish,  holier-than-thou, nose-in-the-air look that lying, stone-walling bitch is giving to  Congress and Senate leaders during the hearings.  You could not get a better picture of what the entire Obama Administration thinks about this country. That face.  That is the way Obama looks at America.
They lie, they steal, they cover up and there's not a God Damned thing you can do about it, so just sit down and shut up. That look.
I would like Obama to take the witness stand and answer why the IRS paid over 80 visits to the Whitehouse during the time that they were harassing Conservative groups. Would absolutely love to hear the tapes from those secret meetings.
NEWS  HEADLINE:
IRS finds more key hard-drive crashes, claims no evidence of tampering.  ( I just love this,  IRS is investigating itself and  OOPS !!  More hard drive crashes !!  )
The Internal Revenue Service is missing e-mails from five more employees whose records could shed light on the agency's targeting scandal, but there are no signs that personnel have intentionally destroyed evidence, according to an IRS review.  ( Do you believe that one ?) 
In a report to four congressional committees on Friday, the IRS said hard-drive crashes are to blame for the lost communications. The agency added that the computer malfunctions "appear to be the same sorts of issues routinely experienced within the IRS, in other government agencies and in the private sector."  (  Routinely experienced when there is an urgent need to cover Obama's lying ass )
The report also noted that the crashes occurred before the start of investigations into how the agency identified nonprofit advocacy groups for extra scrutiny. The IRS's inspector general released an audit last year that said the agency inappropriately targeted certain organizations based on their names and policy positions.
The IRS notified Congress earlier this year that it is missing a years worth of e-mails from Lois Lerner, the ex-agency official whose department was at the center of the targeting scandal. Lerner retired from the government in September 2013, about four months after acknowledging her office's mistakes.
IRS chief John Koskinen testified at a hearing in June that the agency lost many of Lerner's e-mail records after her hard-drive crashed in 2011. ( A crash that didn't really happen )  He said the agency tried unsuccessfully to recover the data and then sent the broken device away for destruction.  ( Which we now know is not true, another lie ) 
The IRS said in its report on Friday that the agency now knows of five more employees who are missing e-mails because of hard-drive crashes. The staff members include: Judy Kindell, who was Lerner's former senior adviser; IRS tax-law specialist Justin Lowe, who worked with Kindell; IRS manager Ron Shoemaker, who helped oversee the cases in question; and two Cincinnati-based IRS employees who had worked on some of the cases. ( All the people involved in the IRS probe who covered for Obama vote Democrat )
The agency said all of the employees contacted IT staff and attempted to recover their data after their computers malfunctioned. ( No malfunction;  they worked perfectly well, right up to the point that they might implicate Obama and Lois Lerner )
The IRS said in a recent court filing that it also "removed or wiped clean" information from Lerner's Blackberry in June 2012, after congressional staffers began questioning her -- and in the same month that TIGTA began its review of the matter. The mobile device may have contained duplicates of Lerner's missing e-mails.  ( All wiped clean,  per direct orders from Obama )
RELATED: Why did the IRS clean out Lois Lerner's Blackberry as probes began?  ( To protect Obama ) 
The IRS has not explained why it erased information from Lerner's Blackberry in June 2012.   ( To protect Obama ) 
Republicans have suggested that the Obama administration used the IRS to hinder emerging conservative and tea party groups during the past two election cycles, when the agency used the inappropriate screening methods.  ( Obviously )
Democrats have rejected that theory.  ( Of course )
The Senate Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations issued a report last week saying it found "no evidence of IRS political bias" in the IRS's targeting actions. ( To protect Obama )
Republicans are saying the TIGTA audit was "accurate and proper" and that 83 percent of the groups that the IRS pulled aside for extra scrutiny were conservative.

NEWS  Headline:
'There's no control': Hawaii watches lava's creep
Lava Flows Threaten Hawaii Homes
PAHOA, Hawaii (AP) -- Lava from one of the world's most active volcanos has been advancing at a slower pace the past few days and is now moving parallel to a sparsely populated subdivision on Hawaii's Big Island.
Lava from Kilauea volcano was still at least a mile from any homes in Kaohe Homesteads, Hawaii County Civil Defense Director Darryl Oliveira said.
Oliveira took a helicopter flight over the area Monday and saw the lava had crept about 150 yards from the previous day. It's moving north for now but could still stop or change directions.
"It's been doing that for the last several days," he said of its northern pull. Prior to Friday, it was going northeast toward the subdivision.
The Hawaiian Volcano Observatory has warned the lava could reach the subdivision in a matter of days.
Oliveira said he didn't anticipate issuing an evacuation order Monday. But residents should be prepared because it's difficult to predict the lava's movement. It was also raining over the flow site, he noted, which meant there wasn't a wildfire threat.
"That's good for today," he said. "But it doesn't get us out of any potential threat down the road. It just means it's going to be a very slow process."
The lava warning has created an "edgy" mood in Puna, the rural region on the southeast side of the Big Island that is at risk from the lava.  "Everybody's a little concerned," he said. "Everybody's a little worried.......... We just have to see where the lava goes. There's no control. It's Mother Nature."
))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))

post_title: "I am no one, who are you? Are you no one too?"
post_text:
While I sit alone in bed, the knowledge of the absence of another spreads, consuming me. Tonight, just tonight, on the way back from a walk my eyes filled with tears, unexpectedly. They say for some that love exists, but for others it does not. I'm afraid I am in lot of those who have no second part.
What fate is this? How can this be? That a play which features me, long written ere I was born, sees fit to lack a counter-part? What cruelty is this? To make me more than plain, with the ability to see -- there is nothing in another meant for me.
To feel a hand, just a hand of an honest, caring friend....the intimacy of just a caring hand out stretched to me, of him who lays not next to me.

post_title: The needle in a haystack you have been looking for!
post_text:
Its a rainy day so this seems like a good time to update my ad. The best place to start is a bit about who I am.
I have been living in NH for 3.5 years now but before that I came from a much more urban environment. Frankly I hated it but its hard to cut the ties from your family and friends to actually do something about it so I stuck it out. That is until my x and I broke up and I came up to what was my cabin to think about life and relax a bit. Well... I never left. I rebuilt the cabin into a nice home I'm happy with and added a garage and barn.
My life is here now and I love it. The area I live in is not unlike a 50s family show. (Except they party more up here) The people here are just so down to earth and have welcomed me into their lives its all a big family.
Since moving up here I have become a somewhat typical bachelor. I have covered my walls with rough cut pine boards and decorated it like a cabin should be. I even created a bar and large entertainment room where we all meet a few times a week for cards and just to hang out. 
I am not without my own odd guy-like hobbies however, I collect trucks and I'm not just talking just pickups and jeeps (I have those too). I'm talking big ones. The place is by no means a junkyard, but I do have more vehicles than average. I find the time working on them to be relaxing and it keeps me out of trouble. 
All is exactly like I wished it would be all my life with the one exception: YOU. OK lets be real perhaps its not you but it could be. My life now is almost a dream. There is no drama, no BS, and perhaps the happiest its ever been but somewhere we all long for companionship and it would be nice to share my world with someone special. At the same time I know that inviting the wrong person into it could change my dream into a nightmare so I have spent some time thinking about what I really want and created a list. 
-I don't date alcoholics, I've been there, done that and I'm not doing that again. If you drink here and there, even if you get drunk occasionally thats fine but if you drink daily youre not the one for me. I don't drink, its not written in stone but on average I will have one beer or two a month and perhaps once every other year I get drunk. Every time I get drunk, 2-3 days after I am violently sick so after years of getting myself sick enough times I finally learned its not for me. I am however 420 friendly. I'm not one of those guys with dreadlocks who worship it nor someone who waste his life in front of the TV with a bag of doritos but in the right setting I enjoy it.
-Kids, It seems that anyone I meet has kids, sometimes lots of them. I like kids and they seem to love me but my life is not exactly kid friendly. Its hard to just pick up and travel with kids in tow.
-I also love to travel. I dont care if its a day trip to the white mountains or a 3 week drive across the US to the other side of the country, I love being behind the wheel on the road. It doesn't end there, I enjoy cruise ships and even Europe so if your with me its best that your not a homebody or couch potato.
-I don't date anyone on physiological meds. Perhaps they help you to stay calm and thats great but I never want to have to use the phrase: "Please forgive her, she is off her meds again". None of us are completely perfect physically or mentally and we all have some issues however if your issues are so grand that meds are needed I rather not put myself through that... again.
-I don't smoke cigarettes If you are a respectful smoker that's fine with me but I will ask that you don't smoke in my home or my vehicles. Truth is I have yet to date a woman that didn't smoke so don't let this be a deal killer. I am respectful of smokers as well and I will remember you need a cig. However if we are at Disneyworld and spend our entire trip looking for the smoking area and not screaming down a roller coaster then yes you can guarantee its going to upset me. 
-I would also like to mention I don't care about how rich or poor you are. I happened to be born into poverty and whatever I have I earned myself. We don't choose the household we are born into so I don't hold someone's finances against anyone, rich or poor as long as you don't feel like you're better than anyone else because you're rich or entitled to other peoples money because you're poor. The way I look at it is it cost me no more to have a passenger with me in my travels than if I'm by myself so you really don't need money as long as you're not expecting me to buy you lavishing gifts. I see no value in shiny trinkets anyway.
-Here is one I would think I didn't have to mention but experience tells me I do. You need to be truly single. That means you have no man you want to be with, are not living with a man who you don't want to be with and whatever past relationships you have had in the past is indeed truly over and in the past. I have zero, notta, zilch drama in my life, it's peaceful and I aim to keep it that way. I am not a player nor a man whore, if we are dating then you expect me to be exclusive to you. I expect the same from you in return.
-I don't date overweight women infact I prefer skinny. Its not a choice I actively make, its something that is hardwired in my head and have no ability to change. I can be friends with anyone but I am physically attracted to slender women. You dont need to be a model but thin is what I am attracted to.
Now with all that said, some of you are thinking "This guy is asking for way too much". Well that might be but I'm happy with my life as it is even if I am single. I have so many wonderful friends and people close to me that I never feel lonely nor do I let being single prevent me from doing anything I like to do. (Except for going on another cruise, that's just odd to go by yourself) I would love to have someone by my side whom is more than just a friend but seriously I rather be single than with someone that is not the right match. 
If you think that you might be that special lady and meet what I am looking for then attach a picture and say hello. Mention something in this add along with the picture of yourself so I know its not spam or I will just assume its more span and delete it. Please be of at least legal age but younger than my mom.

RCW 46.61.100
Keep right except when passing, etc.
(1) Upon all roadways of sufficient width a vehicle shall be driven upon the right half of the roadway, except as follows:
     (a) When overtaking and passing another vehicle proceeding in the same direction under the rules governing such movement;
     (b) When an obstruction exists making it necessary to drive to the left of the center of the highway; provided, any person so doing shall yield the right-of-way to all vehicles traveling in the proper direction upon the unobstructed portion of the highway within such distance as to constitute an immediate hazard;
     (c) Upon a roadway divided into three marked lanes and providing for two-way movement traffic under the rules applicable thereon; 
     (d) Upon a street or highway restricted to one-way traffic; or
     (e) Upon a highway having three lanes or less, when approaching a stationary authorized emergency vehicle, tow truck or other vehicle providing roadside assistance while operating warning lights with three hundred sixty degree visibility, or police vehicle as described under *RCW 46.61.212(2).
     (2) Upon all roadways having two or more lanes for traffic moving in the same direction, all vehicles shall be driven in the right-hand lane then available for traffic, except (a) when overtaking and passing another vehicle proceeding in the same direction, (b) when traveling at a speed greater than the traffic flow, (c) when moving left to allow traffic to merge, or (d) when preparing for a left turn at an intersection, exit, or into a private road or driveway when such left turn is legally permitted. On any such roadway, a vehicle or combination over ten thousand pounds shall be driven only in the right-hand lane except under the conditions enumerated in (a) through (d) of this subsection.
     (3) No vehicle towing a trailer or no vehicle or combination over ten thousand pounds may be driven in the left-hand lane of a limited access roadway having three or more lanes for traffic moving in one direction except when preparing for a left turn at an intersection, exit, or into a private road or driveway when a left turn is legally permitted. This subsection does not apply to a vehicle using a high occupancy vehicle lane. A high occupancy vehicle lane is not considered the left-hand lane of a roadway. The department of transportation, in consultation with the Washington state patrol, shall adopt rules specifying (a) those circumstances where it is permissible for other vehicles to use the left lane in case of emergency or to facilitate the orderly flow of traffic, and (b) those segments of limited access roadway to be exempt from this subsection due to the operational characteristics of the roadway.
 *****    (4) It is a traffic infraction to drive continuously in the left lane of a multilane roadway when it impedes the flow of other traffic. *****
     (5) Upon any roadway having four or more lanes for moving traffic and providing for two-way movement of traffic, a vehicle shall not be driven to the left of the center line of the roadway except when authorized by official traffic control devices designating certain lanes to the left side of the center of the roadway for use by traffic not otherwise permitted to use such lanes, or except as permitted under subsection (1)(b) of this section. However, this subsection shall not be construed as prohibiting the crossing of the center line in making a left turn into or from an alley, private road or driveway.

I found the cut and paste of RCW to be a good thing. 
Folks should review these laws much more often than they do. In my experience, over millions of miles driven, I'm sickened that my fellow drivers ignore these laws, near - ALL OF THEM.. that govern the "Rules of the Road".
Those people that complain about having an empty left lane that they can use do drive whatever speed they want and use one portion of the laws in force requiring lane position, at least here, completely forget about the OTHER laws regarding 'passing behavior', following distances and a whole host of "laws" that govern your behaviors on interstate Highways, State Highways, and other defined "Roadways".
Much of this ill-founded discussion could be completely defused by recognizing the overarching law that REQUIRES .... ALL ... drivers to avoid a collision of any kind. 
In the midst of these words are statements that place the weight, the burden, of motor vehicle operation squarely in the hands of those operating the controls of YOUR vehicle - YOU.
For instance, when you tailgate me because you want me to 'get out of your way', you are creating one of the most dangerous conditions on any roadway. Rear-end collisions are 99.9% completely preventable. In this State, as in most, nailing someone from the rear is your AT-FAULT, regardless.

People like to think that every customer is anonymous and can act however they'd like towards the people taking the time to bring them their food when they most definitely have other tasks to do back at the restaurant/store. Just remember, we do know where you live, usually always have at least a portion of your name, and we all talk to each other, even between businesses, about who has treated us badly and who has treated us well. We care about the customers we deliver for, not only as people we're serving food, but as drivers on the road as well.
When you have the nerve to yell at someone who is 3 minutes late during a football game, or in the even more idiotic circumstance, attempt to intimidate them while they're driving (probably for a few hours in a row without a break or lunch) they're going to remember your address, your license plate, and even your name. They're going to choose to give you bad service or even have their managers, who have most usually been in those same types of situations before and will nearly always side with their driver, refuse you service or give you the food they fucked up on another order with modifications to meet what you asked for. 
On the other hand, you choose to tip well, we remember it and even let other drivers know. Or even if you can't tip because you need money for the rent or groceries or whatever, we honestly don't mind. We just want to be treated like human beings, not food robots, so if you can't tip, seriously, just talk to us for a minute. Most of the time we just want to remember that people can be decent in any situation, even something as simple as a business exchange at your doorstep.
Fortunately, I've many more stories of people who have been nice than those who haven't, but if this ever gets out to the chubby guy who looked like a poor man's "blonde douchebag from the Food Channel" in the black '96-'97 Subaru with the after market spoiler, ugly red stickers on the window, with the overweight girlfriend who had the most horrified expression at his childish behavior as he leaned out the window to yell at me for not noticing I was "riding" him (as he drove 20 mph on a Sunday in August through a school zone that was otherwise 35 mph) after an 8 hour shift, just know that if you ever threaten another driver-by-employment, many of them are far less kind than I am and won't just shrug off your threatening my safety with the idea that you "might have a gun". You're from Bellingham. You aren't intimidating or tough. Remember: drivers talk to other drivers and we have a knack for remembering license plates.
This probably ended up a lot more hostile than I intended it to be. I mostly just wanted to post something for those who haven't been in the situations we have to understand and many empathize a little with what we try to do for other people. We know we take the frequent risk of our licenses, our wallets, and our safety when we go out every day and sometimes speed a little, play a little risky with how we choose to drive, or take the long way around because we're going to avoid 10 minutes of traffic and that way takes 8. We care about the people we serve our food to and I've never met a delivery driver at multiple places I've worked at who otherwise doesn't care about their customers. Just remember to show us some respect once in awhile, even if you just see us with a sign on the side or a topper on our vehicle, we're trying to do the best we can for people just like you, even if it isn't your order, because you and we both know that sign is pretty provocative and you're going to be ordering something eventually. Bellingham is the worst place I've delivered in and just getting to know some people here the last few months from a variety of places in town, I know that isn't how they want to be known to the food service workers in town.

post_title: 11 Ways You Know You Live In A Country Run By Idiots
post_text:
Originally posted by Dr. Eowyn at Fellowship of The Minds blog,
1. If you can get arrested for hunting or fishing without a license, but not for being in the country illegally, you live in a country run by idiots.
2. If you have to get your parents' permission to go on a field trip or take an aspirin in school, but not to get an abortion, you live in a country run by idiots.
3. If you have to show identification to board an airplane, cash a check, buy liquor or check out a library book, but not to vote on who runs the government, you live in a country run by idiots.
4. If the government wants to ban stable, law-abiding citizens from owning gun magazines with more than ten rounds, but gives 20 F-16 fighter jets to the crazy leaders in Egypt, you live in a country run by idiots.
5. If, in the largest city, you can buy two 16-ounce sodas, but not a 24-ounce soda because 24-ounces of a sugary drink might make you fat, you live in a country run by idiots.
6. If an 80-year-old woman can be stripped searched by the TSA but a woman in a hijab is only subject to having her neck and head searched, you live in a country run by idiots.
7. If your government believes that the best way to eradicate trillions of dollars of debt is to spend trillions more, you live in a country run by idiots.
8. If a seven year old boy can be thrown out of grade school for saying his teacher's "cute," but hosting a sexual exploration or diversity class in grade school is perfectly acceptable, you live in a country run by idiots.
9. If hard work and success are met with higher taxes and more government intrusion, while not working is rewarded with EBT cards, WIC checks, Medicaid, subsidized housing and free cell phones, you live in a country run by idiots.
10. If the government's plan for getting people back to work is to incentivize NOT working, with 99 weeks of unemployment checks and no requirement to prove they applied but can't find work, you live in a country run by idiots.
11. If being stripped of the ability to defend yourself makes you more "safe" according to the government, you live in a country run by idiots.
